image.altText: An open power box out the front of a hospital with a hard hat resting on top

props.synopsis: The report said the transformer was 30 years old, beyond its rated life of 25 years, but within the recommended limits of plus or minus five years, and the fuse switch was too old and should have been replaced.

title.children: SA hospital blackout caused by aging infrastructure, including fuse switch that was almost 50 years old, review finds

image.altText: A man and a woman stand with serious expressions with trees in the background

props.synopsis: South Australian Police Commissioner Grant Stevens has thanked the public for their "overwhelming" support since the death of his 18-year-old son Charlie, who died in an alleged hit-and-run a month ago.

title.children: SA's Police Commissioner thanks public for support, a month after getting 'phone call that no parent wants to receive'

image.altText: A man in a red t-shirt and glasses looks directly at the camera while walking outside a court building

props.synopsis: Shivan Suresh Agravat, who pleaded guilty to rape and deception two days into his trial, has been sentenced to a non-parole period of four years and six months, backdated to December 2020 when he was first taken into custody.

title.children: Rapist who used fake AFP ID to enter Adelaide hotel room could be released from jail as early as 2025

image.altText: A close-up of Lisa Wilkinson smiling.

props.synopsis: Lisa Wilkinson is facing a second day of cross-examination as she defends a defamation case brought by former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Lisa Wilkinson's objectivity questioned after revelation she accused Linda Reynolds of 'lying through her teeth'

image.altText: Harry in a suit exits a car.

props.synopsis: A London High Court judge found unlawful actions contributed to 15 articles being written and said Prince Harry had been a victim of "modest" phone-hacking.

title.children: Prince Harry awarded $268,000 in phone-hacking lawsuit against British tabloid

image.altText: Stills of video which played a role in the Australian's four month investigation

props.synopsis: The South Australian government refers allegations over the origins of First Nations artwork to "investigative agencies". A review panel had considered claims that non-Indigenous staff members from the APY Arts Centre Collective intervened in artworks and made efforts to conceal the activity.

title.children: Review into origins of First Nations artwork refers allegations to investigative agencies

image.altText: Four emergency apps on an iPhone home page.

props.synopsis: After the Black Summer bushfires, a royal commission suggested a single mobile phone app for emergency warnings be developed. But that hasn't happened yet, meaning people travelling interstate need to download and familiarise themselves with multiple apps to keep safe.

title.children: Travelling this summer? You'll likely need multiple apps to stay across emergency warnings

image.altText: A greyhound assistance dog

props.synopsis: The teen says the airline has previously allowed her Western Australian registered and trained assistance dog on board, but rejected her application to fly with the same dog next month. It's prompted calls from disability advocates for a standardised national policy.

title.children: 'Restrictive and confusing': Jetstar policy criticised after teen's assistance dog rejected

image.altText: Four swimmers coming out of the water with their arms raised

props.synopsis: Ocean swimmers in SA's South East started wearing magnetic deterrents after one of their members was attacked by a shark. A researcher says the devices are giving them false peace of mind.

title.children: Shark deterrents have given these swimmers confidence to get back in the water, but do they work?

image.altText: A young woman in Santa hat and swimsuit looks at the ocean under blue skies

props.synopsis: Early modelling indicates Christmas Day will see showers and thunderstorms up and down the eastern seaboard along with a potential cyclone tormenting the northern tropics.

title.children: Christmas Day weather forecast for your city as Jasper threat remains

image.altText: Two children draw, smiling.

props.synopsis: Families say childhood dementia is underfunded and under-researched and they want greater public awareness to help improve their children's short lives.

title.children: Jill knew her children had a problem. It turned out to be kids' dementia

image.altText: traditional chinese-style buildings that make up the forbidden city complex covered in snow in a haze

props.synopsis: President Xi Jinping called for "all-out" emergency response efforts as a cold wave froze most of China on Friday, affecting transport and sending hundreds to hospital after a train crash in Beijing.

title.children: Cold wave freezes China, sending hundreds to hospital after Beijing train crash

image.altText: A soldier walks away from the camera towards a military vehicle as smoke billows behind

props.synopsis: Two cargo ships have been struck in the Red Sea after being hit by projectiles fired from the rebel-held Yemen, where Houthi rebels have been targeting shipping in response to the Israel-Gaza war.

title.children: Projectiles hit Red Sea ships amid Houthi response to Israel-Gaza war

image.altText: Three sailors wave on the deck of a boat with a city skyline, water and a ferry visible in the background

props.synopsis: The commander of Australia's naval fleet says the service is well prepared to deploy a warship to the Middle East if the Albanese government agrees to join an international mission to protect merchant vessels in the Red Sea.

title.children: Navy declares it's ready for any Middle East deployment following United States request

image.altText: Four syringes of compounded semaglutide, lying on a table.

props.synopsis: Australia's medicines regulator issues a public safety warning over unauthorised replicas of the popular weight loss drug Ozempic, after an ABC investigation revealed hundreds of patients have been ordering off-brand versions online.

title.children: TGA issues safety alert after compounding pharmacies use 'loophole' to make Ozempic replicas

image.altText: Woman with head in hands with tax return on screen in the background.

props.synopsis: The inspector-general of taxation is investigating the theft and hijacking of personal information that has allowed millions of dollars of tax fraud by professional scammers.

title.children: Inspector-General of Taxation investigates ATO myGov scams

image.altText: A woman wearing a black puffer jacket and face mask seen through metal bars.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian businesswoman Jan Cameron, the founder of clothing giant Kathmandu, used offshore entities to hide her control of shares in baby formula company Bellamy's, a court has found.

title.children: Kathmandu founder guilty of using offshore entity to hide control of $14m in shares

image.altText: a large tree that has fallen into a wire fence, crushing it

props.synopsis: A 30-year-old man has died after emergency services found him unconscious near fallen powerlines as dangerous thunderstorms swept across Queensland's south-east.

title.children: Police investigating after man dies in severe south-east Queensland storms

image.altText: A group of people standing outside in a carpark with a sign for Casuarina Square in the background

props.synopsis: NT Police arrest a man after a brawl involving up to 50 people at Darwin's busy Casuarina shopping centre saw one youth allegedly running at shoppers wielding a machete.

title.children: Teen tasered amid mass brawl at popular Darwin shopping centre

image.altText: picture of a man holding a metal bucket sitting in a football stadium behind the goal post

props.synopsis: The man who used a metal bucket to attack Melbourne City goalkeeper Thomas Glover is spared jail and is instead sentenced to a community corrections order after an appeal.

title.children: 'Bucket man' spared jail time for pitch invasion attack

image.altText: Police outside a high school

props.synopsis: A Perth teenager pleads guilty to injuring a fellow student with a sharp weapon on high school grounds.

title.children: Teenager who attacked fellow student with sharp weapon subject to 'horrendous' bullying at school

image.altText: The crumpled front of a white BMW SUV, surrounded by emergency services tape.

props.synopsis: The driver of an SUV that crashed into patrons outside a regional Victorian pub last month, killing five people, is granted bail by a Melbourne magistrate.

title.children: Lawyer for diabetic Daylesford pub crash driver tells court his client is a 'model patient'

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of a man with short hair looking downwards while walking outside.

props.synopsis: A Perth man, who is already in jail for sexually abusing a teenage girl, pleads guilty to almost 120 charges of the online "sextortion" of hundreds of girls from around the world.

title.children: Man admits 'sextortion' blackmailing of hundreds of young girls while pretending to be teenage social media celebrity

props.synopsis: The latest National Health Survey shows the number of Australians smoking each day continues to drop.

title.children: Smoking on the decline as mental health diagnoses climb: Here's what new data tells us about Australia's health

image.altText: A woman walks at the Darwin Local Court.

props.synopsis: Fingerprint expert Jeannie Secrett has been found not guilty of disseminating confidential COVID-19 information in a group chat at the height of the pandemic.

title.children: NT police officer acquitted of disclosing confidential COVID information during pandemic

image.altText: An AFL player in a black training shirt, catches a football

props.synopsis: Brayden Maynard backs the AFL's expected crackdown on smothers that was prompted by the Collingwood defender's own controversial tribunal case.

title.children: Magpies star Maynard supports AFL's proposed smother rule change

image.altText: A Brsbane Lions AFLW player holds the ball during the grand final.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions are celebrating remarkable list stability after retaining almost all of their grand final squad for next season's premiership defence.

title.children: Lions re-sign key trio in wake of AFLW premiership triumph

image.altText: Shark bite victims records the incident

props.synopsis: People aren't the only species attracted to the summer waters along Australia's coastline — underneath the surface, tuna, mackerel and schools of bait fish are moving closer to shore, bringing with them sharks.

title.children: Video shows shark attack victim's narrow escape as experts share tips on reducing risk

image.altText: Barry Humphries wears a suit and a hat as he stands in front of a large sculpture of gladioli, which has light softly on it.

props.synopsis: Tributes from King Charles III, the prime minister and entertainment peers are shared as hundreds gather at the Sydney Opera House.

title.children: Family and friends remember 'remarkable' Barry Humphries at state memorial

image.altText: two black and white teen students with backpacks facing away from the camera, another sits behind a computer with their hand up.

props.synopsis: City public primary schools have dominated the list of high-performing schools, according to analysis of NAPLAN data, as school results are released today.

title.children: High-performing schools in each state and territory revealed as state NAPLAN results released
